message.content:
cs.SI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY. 

The paper presents a crowd-sensing system that leverages cell-phone sensors to automatically recognize different passengers' activities and infer their associated transit stations semantics. This involves data mining, machine learning, and location estimation techniques, which are relevant to several CS sub-categories. Specifically, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely category since the paper deals with crowd-sensing and social interactions in transit stations. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is also likely since the paper discusses the use of cell-phone sensors and the unobtrusive nature of the system. cs.LG (Machine Learning) is relevant since the paper employs machine learning techniques to recognize passengers' activities and infer semantics. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is relevant since the paper deals with the discovery and labeling of indoor floorplans semantics. Finally, cs.CY (Computers and Society) is relevant since the paper discusses the potential impact of the system on indoor maps enriching services.
